FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION

  • Description: The package came down the QA01 belt. It did not have any other label beside the shipping label. I saw there is a HAZ on the shipping label and a wet spot on one of the side of the box near the bottom. The package is a damaged hazmat that was repacked in a corrugated box with no dot or OP-900 by Nicole M. Adkins (3413529)

item.title: Report I-2024060025
item.description:
Report I-2024060025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-19
  • City: WEST MIFFLIN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No A/C Damage or injuries. Upon unloading the Inbound flight 3909 from BNA. The Ramp agent discovered two bags that were stucldmelted together. Upon peeling the bags apart there was physical damage to both bags. The Hard-shell bag did not have any items impacted on the inside. The softshell bag had an almost completely empty 16oz. bottle of nail polish remover along with a laptop which was still functional and not damaged. Pictures available upon request.

item.title: Report X-2024061143
item.description:
Report X-2024061143

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE FOUND IN UNLOAD. UPON INSPECTION THE BOX WAS WET AND ONCE OPENED THE CAP WAS LOOSE AND LEAKED ON THE INSIDE AND OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE.
